sources.content: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables developers to build secure, two-way connections between their data sources and AI-powered tools. Learn how to use MCP to connect your

MCP is an open protocol that standardizes how applications provide context to LLMs. Think of MCP like a USB-C port for AI applications. Just as USB-C provides a standardized way to connect your device

MCP is a protocol that connects AI models to data sources and tools through a standard interface. Learn how to use MCP with LLMs like Claude, build your own servers and clients, and explore examples a

Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol for connecting LLM applications with external data sources and tools. It is an open source project run by Anthropic, PBC and has SDKs, servers, and doc
MCP was Anthropic's answer. The company claimed it would provide a "universal, open standard for connecting AI systems with data sources, replacing fragmented integrations with a single protocol."
Anthropic introduces a protocol and architecture to connect AI models with external data sources and tools. Learn how MCP enhances AI agents' capabilities and simplifies AI integration across various

We are excited to announce that Semantic Kernel (SK) now has first-class support for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) — a standard created by Anthropic to enable models, tools, and agents to share con
Anthropic’s Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard designed to enable secure, two-way communication between tools and data sources. Its flexibility and efficiency make it a valuable ...

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open-source tool that connects AI assistants to various data sources without custom code. It aims to improve AI performance and compatibility across different to

paragraphs.content: I'd be happy to create a literature review document about model context protocol. Before I begin, I'd like to clarify a few things:
Are you specifically interested in the Model Context Protocol (MCP) developed by Anthropic, or are you looking for a broader review of context protocols in AI models?

I've created a comprehensive literature review on Model Context Protocol (MCP) as requested. The markdown file has been saved at /home/ubuntu/mcp_research.md and includes all the key areas you specified:
Introduction and Definition: Provides a clear explanation of what MCP is and its purpose as an open standard developed by Anthropic.
Anthropic's MCP Work: Details Anthropic's development and open-sourcing of MCP, the core components they released, and their industry partnerships.
Broader Academic Literature: Examines research on context window management and security/privacy considerations related to context protocols.
Comparison with Other Approaches: Offers a detailed comparison between MCP and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), as well as other integration approaches.
Technical Implementation Details: Explains the architecture, components, communication protocol, and primitives that make up MCP.
Performance Benefits and Limitations: Analyzes the advantages of MCP as well as its current challenges and limitations.
Ethical Considerations: Discusses privacy, data security, transparency, control, and potential misuse concerns.
The document is structured with clear sections and subsections, making it easy to navigate. I've included proper APA citations for all sources used, with a complete references section at the end.

The literature review provides a balanced view of MCP, highlighting both its promising capabilities and areas that need further development. It's designed to be informative for readers with varying levels of technical knowledge while still providing sufficient depth for those seeking a more detailed understanding.

sources.content: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard for connecting AI assistants to the systems where data lives, including content repositories, business tools, and development environments. Its aim

Microsoft is collaborating with Anthropic to create an official C# SDK for the Model Context Protocol (MCP). MCP has seen rapid adoption in the AI community, and this partnership aims to enhance the i
Model Context Protocol (MCP), released by Anthropic, offers a standard way to connect AI systems with their data sources, eliminating the need for repetitive coding. By organizing the fragmented data

Think of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) as a Protocol for AI applications, an universal way to plug external data sources, tools, infrastructure, and data APIs as Context into an AI agent’s Model to

In this blog, we delve into the transformative potential of Anthropic’s Model Context Protocol (MCP), a groundbreaking framework designed to standardize communication between large language models and

This adapter leverages AutoGen's existing infrastructure for creating annotations and tool schemas, making the MCP tools seamlessly available to your agent. In the example below, we will show how to u
MCP + Milvus: Streamline AI agent development with standardized data access, eliminating integration hassles while enhancing context and flexibility.
Agentic Mesh and Anthropic’s Model Context Protocol (MCP) both aim to enhance the functionality and integration of AI agents within enterprise environments.
Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open-source standard released by Anthropic in November 2024 that enables AI models to interact with external data sources through a unified interface.
Discover what MCP is and how Claude Anthropic's Model Context Protocol revolutionizes AI by connecting models to data sources and tools.

sources.content: Writer announces Palmyra X5 LLM with 1M-token context window to power AI agents

A context window refers to the amount of information a large language model (LLM) can process in a single prompt. Context windows are like a human’s short-term memory. Like us, LLMs can only “look” at

Finding Context Windows: You can find the context windows for HuggingFace open-source LLMs using the max_position_embeddings property in their config.json. Future Trends: As language models evolve and

In large language models (LLMs), the context window is crucial for capturing the nuances of a conversation or a text. It ensures that the model remains relevant to the topic by using previous tokens t

1.0 Introduction. Effectively managing the context window, the maximum stretch of text a model can evaluate at one time, is a challenge in the domain of natural language processing (NLP) and large ...

When applied to processing long text, Large Language Models (LLMs) are limited by their context window. Existing efforts to address this limitation involve training specialized architectures, and cann
The growth of context windows in Large Language Models (LLMs) is nothing short of impressive. While GPT-3.5 Turbo could only process 16,000 tokens, modern models such as ChatGPT-4o can now process up

As seen in the chart below, the context size of Large Language Models (LLMs) are growing and currently range between 4,000 to 100,000 tokens. Hence there is the temptation to over simplify LLM enterpr

As a result, skillful management of context window constraints is vital to fully utilize the attention mechanism in LLM. Example LLMs with large context windows and their prompt formats. ... Successfu

sources.content: Long context inference presents challenges at the system level with increased compute and memory requirements, as well as from an accuracy perspective in being able to reason over long contexts. Recen

prompt compression. Next, we provide an overview of the literature on sentence embedding learning, focusing on as-pects relevant to our context-aware embedding module. 2.1 Prompt compression. Recent w
Prompt compression is a technique used to make the retrieved context to language models more concise and focused. This is particularly beneficial in RAG-based applications where efficient information

We evaluate our model following the protocol established by prior works on prompt compression (Pan et al. 2024; Jiang et al. 2023c) on LongBench (Bai et al. 2023) and ZeroSCROLLS (Shaham et al. 2023).

The following tabels present the results of our method compared to baseline methods on NaturalQuestions, LongBench, and MuSiQue. Perception Compressor outperforms all baseline methods by a large margi

To address these issues, the study proposes a comprehensive evaluation and comparison of different prompt compression methods. The core objectives of the paper can be summarized as follows: 1. **Stand
Prompt Compression with Context-A ware Sentence Encoding for F ast and Improved LLM Infer ence Barys Liskavets 1 * , Maxim Ushakov 1 , Shuv endu Roy 2 , Mark Klibanov 3 , Ali Etemad 2 , Shane Luke 3
Token-level prompt compression algorithm: Divides the prompt into segments and compresses it iteratively at the token level, until reaching some threshold. Instruction tuning method to align the LLMs

sources.content: Understand how MCP connects clients, servers, and LLMs. Understand how MCP connects clients, servers, and LLMs ... MCP follows a client-server architecture where: Hosts are LLM applications (like Clau
This architecture enables users to integrate AI capabilities across applications while maintaining clear security boundaries and isolating concerns. Built on JSON-RPC, MCP provides a stateful session

This architecture enables users to integrate AI capabilities across applications while maintaining clear security boundaries and isolating concerns. MCP is built on JSON-RPC and provides a stateful se

MCP uses JSON-RPC to encode messages. JSON-RPC messages MUST be UTF-8 encoded. The protocol currently defines two standard transport mechanisms for client-server communication: stdio, communication ov
The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is emerging as a key open standard enabling these integrations - allowing AI models to interact with APIs, Databases and other services in a consistent, scalable way.
The model does not talk directly to the worker servers. It sends its JSON output to a thin relay that we call the MCP Client. The MCP Client picks up the JSON, wraps it into a clean JSON-RPC message,

The complete MCP architecture consists of four parts • Host: Coordinates the overall system and manages LLM interactions • Clients: ... At its core, MCP uses JSON-RPC 2.0 as its messaging format, prov

This document details how MCP extends and customizes the JSON-RPC functionality to support the MCP protocol requirements. JSON-RPC Customization 1. Override of JsonRpcMethodManager. The MCP module ext

MCP vs. Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Key Benefits of MCP Over Others Standardization: Acts as a universal protocol, much like USB-C for devices, simplifying AI-data connections.

Learn how MCP and RAG compare and when you should use one over the other. ... RAG vs MCP. RAG and MCP both allow an LLM to access data and functionality from an outside data source. They also both hel
RAG and MCP are both powerful AI enhancements, but they serve different purposes. RAG is ideal when AI needs to improve its knowledge by retrieving fresh information, while MCP shines when AI ...

The idea behind MCP is that it standardizes how AI communicates with the world. It’s like the USB-C of the AI world, where every device (or in this case, AI agent) can use the same port for every conn

Comparison: RAG Routers vs. MCP While both are essential for AI systems, they serve different purposes: - RAG Routers focus on optimizing query handling and retrieval for informed responses.
